[[File:VI.jpg|left|vignette|666x666px|Paralysis of the right VI: abolition of abduction of the right eye]]

question.title: What is the primary function of the abducens nerve?
question.description: The abducens nerve is responsible for controlling the lateral rectus muscle, which is involved in the abduction of the eye.

option_a.title: Control of the superior oblique muscle
option_a.description: The superior oblique muscle is controlled by the trochlear nerve, not the abducens nerve.

option_b.title: Abduction of the eye
option_b.description: The abducens nerve is responsible for controlling the lateral rectus muscle, which is involved in the abduction of the eye.

option_c.title: Adduction of the eye
option_c.description: The abducens nerve is not responsible for controlling the medial rectus muscle, which is involved in the adduction of the eye.

option_d.title: Control of the medial rectus muscle
option_d.description: The medial rectus muscle is controlled by the oculomotor nerve, not the abducens nerve.

correct_option.title: Abduction of the eye
correct_option.description: The abducens nerve is responsible for controlling the lateral rectus muscle, which is involved in the abduction of the eye.
